title: Search if the indexed data is present in the query or not
description: For example, I have got a search query "A quick brown fox". Indexed data contains "fox,name,brown, etc". So when I search with the full string, those indexed data containing parts of the query must also be hit. The query string can be of any size.

comments.content:
Please do not use JIRA for asking questions on how to use Solr. Sign up for the solr-user mailing list and ask questions there, the list is usually very responsive. http://lucene.apache.org/solr/community.html#mailing-lists-irc

When you write to the list, please include a bit more context, i.e. what field type you use when indexing, how you query (paste exact query string that you attempted), what you have tried already and perhaps a concrete example of what you expected the result to be. To me this sounds like a simple OR query (q.op=OR).

I'm closing this issue. Please don't reply here, but followup in the mailing list.
comments.author: Jan Høydahl
